question: Ashraf Ghani and Abdullah Abdullah, who recently signed a power-sharing agreement, are the leaders of which country?
explanation:
The President of Afghanistan Ashraf Ghani and his political rival Abdullah Abdullah have recently signed a power-sharing agreement.
This political step has been finalised two months after both the leaders declared themselves the winner of the presidential election held last September. As per the spokesperson, the political deal seeks Ghani to remain the Afghan President and Abdullah to lead the countryâ€™s National Reconciliation High Council.
